content: अव्यक्त {%<ab>a.</ab>%} {@--1@} Indistinct, not manifest or apparent, inarticulate; °वर्ण indistinct accents <ls>Ś. 7. 17</ls>; फलमव्यक्तमब्रवीत्. {@--2@} Invisible, imperceptible. {@--3@} Undetermined; अव्यक्तोयमचिंत्योयं <ls>Bg. 2. 25</ls>; <ls n="Bg.">8. 20.</ls> {@--4@} Undeveloped, uncreated. {@--5@} (In <ab>alg.</ab>) Unknown (as a quantity or number). --क्तः {@--1@} <ab>N.</ab> of Viṣṇu. {@--2@} <ab>N.</ab> of Śiva. {@--3@} Cupid. {@--4@} Primary matter which has not yet entered into real existence. {@--5@} A fool. --क्तं (In Vedānta <ab>phil.</ab>) {@--1@} The Supreme Being or universal Spirit, Brahma. {@--2@} Spiritual ignorance. {@--3@} The subtle body. {@--4@} The state of sleep (सुषुप्त्यवस्था). {@--5@} (In Sān. <ab>phil.</ab>) The primary germ of nature (सर्वकारण), the primordial element or productive principle from which all the phenomena of the material world are developed; बुद्धेरिवाव्यक्तमुदाहरंति <ls>R. 13. 60</ls>; महतः परमव्यक्तमव्यक्तात्पुरुषः परः <ls>Kaṭh.</ls>, <ls>Sāṅ. K. 2</ls>, <ls n="Sāṅ. K.">10</ls>, <ls n="Sāṅ. K.">14</ls>, <ls n="Sāṅ. K.">16</ls>, <ls n="Sāṅ. K.">58.</ls> {@--6@} The soul. {@--7@} Nature. --क्तं {%<ab>ind.</ab>%} Imperceptibly, indistinctly, inarticulately.
